verses.text: When the LORD your God cuts off the nations whose land the LORD your God is giving you, and you dispossess them and live in their cities and in their houses,
verses.comment: Reflects the same phrasing as Hebrew; 'cuts off' is literal for 'karat', 'live in their cities' maintains the original intent.

verses.text: you shall set apart three cities for yourselves in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
verses.comment: Maintains Hebrew imperative and context of 'set apart'.

verses.text: You shall prepare the roads and divide into three parts the territory of your land that the LORD your God is giving you to inherit, so that any manslayer can flee there.
verses.comment: 'Prepare the roads' translates 'tiddeir lo'; 'any manslayer' keeps Hebrew 'rotseach' for 'killer', meaning one who killed unintentionally.

verses.text: Now this is the case of the manslayer who may flee there and live: anyone who kills his neighbor unintentionally, without having hated him in the past—
verses.comment: 'Unintentionally' is 'without knowledge' (Hebrew 'bivli-da'at'); 'without having hated him in the past' is literal.

verses.text: as when someone goes into the forest with his neighbor to cut wood, and his hand swings the axe to cut the tree, and the iron slips from the handle and strikes his neighbor and he dies—he may flee to one of these cities and live;
verses.comment: Follows the structure of the Hebrew; 'iron slips from the handle' is literal.

verses.text: lest the avenger of blood pursue the manslayer in hot anger and overtake him, because the way is long, and strike him fatally, though he was not deserving of death, since he had not hated him in the past.
verses.comment: 'Avenger of blood' keeps 'goel hadam', meaning redeemer or next of kin; 'in hot anger' reflects the emotion in Hebrew.

verses.text: Therefore I command you: set apart three cities for yourselves.
verses.comment: 'I command you' kept as first person from Moses.

verses.text: And if the LORD your God enlarges your territory, as he swore to your fathers, and gives you all the land that he promised to give to your fathers—
verses.comment: 'Enlarges your territory' is a literal rendering.

verses.text: if you carefully keep all this commandment that I command you today, by loving the LORD your God and by walking always in his ways, then you shall add three more cities for yourselves, besides these three,
verses.comment: 'Add three more cities' is as in the Hebrew; the condition is kept clear.

verses.text: so that innocent blood will not be shed in your land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and so guilt of bloodshed will not be upon you.
verses.comment: 'Innocent blood' is a literal and established phrase.

verses.text: But if anyone hates his neighbor and lies in wait for him and rises up against him and strikes him so that he dies, and then flees into one of these cities,
verses.comment: 'Lies in wait' = premeditation, as in original.

verses.text: then the elders of his city shall send and take him from there and deliver him over into the hand of the avenger of blood, so that he may die.
verses.comment: 'Deliver him over into the hand' follows the original Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: Your eye shall not have pity on him, but you shall purge the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, so that it may go well with you.
verses.comment: 'Your eye shall not have pity' is a literal idiom for not showing mercy in judgment.

verses.text: You shall not move your neighbor's landmark, which the ancestors have set, in the inheritance that you shall hold in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
verses.comment: 'Landmark' is literal ('gebul'); refers to property boundaries.

verses.text: A single witness shall not rise up against a person for any iniquity or for any sin that he commits. Only on the evidence of two or three witnesses shall a charge be established.
verses.comment: 'Two or three witnesses' is direct; 'rise up against' translates the Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: If a malicious witness rises up against someone to accuse him of wrongdoing,
verses.comment: 'Malicious witness' = 'ed hamas' in Hebrew, meaning false witness.

verses.text: then both men between whom the controversy is shall stand before the LORD, before the priests and the judges who are in office in those days.
verses.comment: 'Stand before the LORD' = come to the central sanctuary or authority.

verses.text: The judges shall investigate thoroughly, and if the witness is a false witness and has accused his brother falsely,
verses.comment: 'Investigate thoroughly' = 'to seek, to search out, to inquire well' in Hebrew.

verses.text: then you shall do to him as he intended to do to his brother. So you shall purge the evil from among you.
verses.comment: Retributive justice, matching Hebrew sense; 'purge the evil' is literal.

verses.text: And those who remain shall hear and fear, and never again commit any such evil among you.
verses.comment: 'Hear and fear' is the Hebrew idiom, meaning to learn and be afraid to repeat.

verses.text: Your eye shall not have pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
verses.comment: 'Eye shall not have pity' is literal; 'life for life...' retains the original lex talionis formula.
